name: A Night at the Theater
description: Kelis and Voyager's EMH have partnered to create a new theatrical work based on the temporal anomaly crisis--with Barclay in the starring role. When a potential threat to the production arises, can you help the nervous Barclay to overcome it?
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Kelis, Barclay, B. Torres, or EMH will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Kelis, Barclay, B. Torres or EMH
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Seska
featured_crew.flavor: A year after her death, Seska leaves one last surprise for the Voyager crew in an abandoned holoprogram.

featured_crew.name: Barclay
featured_crew.flavor: In order to overcome his holodeck addiction, Barclay takes on the role of Cyrano de Bergerac before his shipmates.

adventures.name: Chewing the Scenery
adventures.description: Look for incendiary depictions or inaccuracies.

adventures.name: Break a Leg
adventures.description: Find out if Barclay is self-sabotaging out of fear.

adventures.name: Body of Evidence
adventures.description: Physical proof to convict the offenders.

goals.flavor: Hunt in the name of art with the Hirogen.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "Really, Mister Barclay, I'm beginning to regret casting you in the lead role. This play is too important to capturing the moment we're in to leave it an amateur. Or another writer...."
"You need a voice that wasn't literally programmed by the Federation. Mister Barclay's going to be fine. He's just letting his nerves get the best of him."

"Captain... I promise it's not nerves. I mean, I have them, but they're unrelated to the real threat facing this production. Someone doesn't want this show to go on, and I think they're willing to use violence to make sure it doesn't. Can you help me prove it?"
